link.title: Tooele County School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: Tooele County School District serves K-12th grade students and is located in Tooele, UT.

nav.a: End of School Year Plans for 2020

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 1280px; height: 672px;
position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 1280px; height: 672px;

img.alt: Clarke N. Johnsen Junior High School
School Dismissal - New Updates April 24, 2020 Thumbnail Image

article.div: Today's update includes when the last class assignments will be assigned, (May 8) and final due dates, (May 15). There is also new information about grab and go meals for Monday and Wednesday. Please click on the title for full details.

img.alt: School Dismissal - New Updates April 16, 2020 Thumbnail Image

article.div: Governor Herbert announced Tuesday that school dismissal will extend through the rest of the school year. The decision to continue with school dismissal was done throughout the state so schools can retain funding. The last day of school for Tooele County School District is May 21, 2020. There will be no additional work assigned after May 21. However, the state has defined the “end of the school year” as June 30, 2020, and not the last day of school. That means that group activities and locations will remain canceled/closed through June 30, 2020. More information will be forthcoming on restriction changes for July 1, 2020, and beyond. For information about graduation, class grading, school fees, and more click on the title.

img.alt: Great Utah Shakeout, April 16 at 10:15 a.m. Thumbnail Image

h3.a: Great Utah Shakeout, April 16 at 10:15 a.m.

article.div: Join us on Thursday morning, April 16, at 10:15 a.m., as we participate in a statewide earthquake drill. Drop! Cover! Hold on! For more info about this yearly exercise visit: https://www.shakeout.org/utah/

nav.div: Once you click on any one of the following links, you will leave this website. Please note that we are not responsible for any content posted on these websites or the design of these websites.

article.span: Tooele County School District is K-12 with approximately 18,000 students enrolled.
TCSD has 15 elementary schools, 3 junior highs, 4 high schools, 1 K-12 school, 1 special education pre-K, 1 alternative school, and 1 online K-12 school.
TCSD has 8 schools with a Dual Language Immersion program. We offer open enrollment DLI in French, German, Mandarin Chinese, Portuguese, Russian and Spanish.
We have four state-designated STEM schools. STEM curriculum covers four specific disciplines; science, technology, engineering, and mathematics in an interdisciplinary and applied approach.
The boundaries of TCSD cover 7,286 square miles.
Of the 2018-19 graduating class, 69% of those graduates were Career and Technical Education pathway completers. The state average is 20%.
Wendover High, Dugway K-12, Ibapah Elementary and Vernon Elementary have laptops for every student.
